name: MRN LookUp
description: This is a utility EM which overwrites the Create Record functionality to allow users to enter an MRN, and if valid, will populate basic demographic fields in their project

system-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
If you have the Stanford emLogger external module installed and configured, you can enable additional debug-level logging through this checkbox

project-settings.name:
MRN field
Select the field where the MRN will be stored after verification

First Name
Select the field where the first name will be stored after the MRN is verified. If left blank, first name will not be saved. The field should be a text field with no validation

Last Name
Select the field where the last name will be stored after the MRN is verified. If left blank, last name will not be saved. The field should be a text field with no validation

Date of Birth
Select the field where the date of birth will be stored after the MRN is verified. If left blank, birth date will not be saved. The field should be a text field with date validation of 'Y-M-D

Gender
Select the field where gender will be stored after the MRN is verified. If left blank, gender will not be saved. The field should be a text field with no validation

Ethnicity
Select the field where ethnicity will be stored after the MRN is verified. If left blank, ethnicity will not be saved. The field should be a text field with no validation

Race
Select the field where race will be stored after the MRN is verified. If left blank, race will not be saved. The field should be a text field with no validation

Record Name Prefix
The prefix which will be used to name the record. If supplied, the record ID will be created with this prefix and the next number appended to it. For instance, if 'Study' is given as a prefix, the record numbers will be named 'Study1', 'Study2', etc

Number Padding Size
The record label will consist of the Record Name Prefix and an increasing number. This field will specify if the increasing number should be left-padded with 0's so the record label will always be a consistent length. If this number is 5, the first record label will be 'Record Name Prefix' + '00001'
